newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti shareholders want board changes.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti shareholders want board changes.

text.p: The Association of Italian small shareholders and the committee of small shareholders in Olivetti said they wanted to see the election of a new board at Olivetti as the only solution to save the company.
A joint statement by the two shareholder groups said the only way to save the company was the election of a new executive board elected by an assembly of shareholders.

The two groups have asked a group of foreign funds, which represent up 25 percent of the capital in Olivetti, not to be content with just one member on the Olivetti board representing shareholders, as has been suggested by Olivetti.
